jeopardy_round: A SHORT HISTORY OF WESTERN UNION

(1, 1).clue: A childhood woodchopping mishap claimed half of this lead guitarist's right middle finger

(2, 1).clue: Boston's 1-ton-plus King's Chapel bell was recast in 1816 by this patriot

(3, 1).clue: Like humans, guinea pigs need a dietary source of this vitamin, so try feeding them a piece of orange each day

(4, 1).clue: In 1988 she launched her DKNY line

(5, 1).clue: The 2006 New York Times headline on Western Union's last telegram used this word, telegrams' version of a period

(6, 1).clue: Individual crystals of this yellow November birthstone can weigh hundreds of pounds

(1, 2).clue: Slotted between The Who & Hendrix, The Dead was No. 6 to play at this city's 1967 Pop Festival

(2, 2).clue: British Gen. Gage said of the June 1775 battle here, "The loss we have sustained is greater than we can bear"

(3, 2).clue: 16th century essayist Montaigne wondered if this pet used him as a plaything more than he used her

(4, 2).clue: This American designer is a direct descendant of William Claiborne, the 1st governor of the State of Louisiana

(6, 4).clue: A major government building of this state capital is modeled after the Capitol in Washington, D.C.

(2, 5).clue: Since the 18th century, a grasshopper has sat atop the marketplace named for this Huguenot

(4, 5).clue: He's had his own line at Target & his own show on the Oxygen Network

(1, 1).clue: In 1872 she was fined $100 for voting in the presidential election; she never paid it

(2, 1).clue: "License to kill gophers by the government of the United Nations.  Man, free to kill gophers at will"

(2, 2).clue: "I've been stabbed, shocked, poisoned, frozen, hung, electrocuted & burned... I am an immortal"
